name: oat grain production | oat grain | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14990/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of oat grains, at standard water content required for storage (14%). The average yield from 2009 - 2012 is 3.0 t/ha.The data are representative for oat production in Western Canada used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 60-15-0 kg/ha. Organic fertilisers applied amount to 0.03 t/ha of solid manure. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 0.73 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The export share of oat grains produced in Canada amounts to 56% of the global export (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing oat grains produced in Canada for the export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 1.5 (i.e. excellent quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends with the harvest of grains and their transport to the farm gate. The dataset includes all machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation (a mixture of no tillage and minimum tillage), sowing, fertilisation, pesticide application, harvesting, grain drying, and on-farm transport. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. The dataset doesn't include emissions from manure storage because these are within the system boundary of animal production.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country; L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L4; Machinery: L0/L4; Irrigation: L3. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'oat grain' is calculated to be circa 2.60E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonia, liquid', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 5.21E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of oat grain is calculated to be circa 2.41E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'cyclic N-compound', 'glyphosate', 'phenoxy-compound'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 4.83E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
